column4: MOVES-Nomura hires Leng as non-executive chairman for European unit
column5: Dec 17 Tokyo-based financial services provider Nomura Holdings Inc appointed Jim Leng as non-executive chairman of its unit  Nomura Europe Holdings Plc.

column4: UPDATE 1-Lockheed says files complaint over next-generation Humvee contract
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 17 Lockheed Martin Corp on Thursday said it was filing a federal complaint over the handling of a nearly $7 billion contract for next-generation Humvees after it lost its bid to rival Oshkosh Corp.

column4: Pandora says new music royalty rates 'balanced ' shares jump
column5: A U.S. copyright board on Wednesday raised music royalty rates that Pandora Media Inc and Internet radio stations will pay  setting new prices at a range Pandora called "balanced" and sending its shares up 20 percent in after-hours trade.

column4: Pandora to pay more to musicians after Copyright Royalty Board decision
column5: Internet radio companies such as Pandora Media Inc will have to pay more in royalties next year to musicians after the three-judge U.S. Copyright Royalty Board increased the rates for ad-supported streaming by 21.4 percent.

column4: Brazil prosecutors charge 12 in SBM Offshore graft scheme
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazilian prosecutors on Thursday charged 12 people with a bribery scheme involving Dutch firm SBM Offshore NV  the world's top leaser of oil production ships  and state oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil suspects Esteves paid bribes in Africa deal  paper says
column5: BRASILIA  Dec 17 Brazilian prosecutors suspect jailed financier André Esteves paid bribes to buy Africa-based assets from state oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  a newspaper reported  as the country's top court mulls whether to release the billionaire banker on Thursday.

column4: Brazil prosecutors investigating suspected bribery in Esteves case - newspaper
column5: BRASILIA  Dec 17 Brazil's Prosecutor-General Rodrigo Janot suspects jailed financier André Esteves of paying bribes to buy African assets from Brazilian state oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobas)  newspaper Estado de S. Paulo said on Thursday.

column4: WRAPUP 2-U.S. labor market strengthening  factories struggling
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 17 The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits last week fell from a five-month high  suggesting sustained labor market healing that could lead to further Federal Reserve interest rate hikes next year.

column4: U.S. third quarter current account deficit largest since 2008
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. current account deficit in the third quarter widened sharply to its highest level in nearly seven years as a strong dollar weighed on exports and the profits of multinational corporations.

column4: U.S. keeps Prudential designated as systemically important firm
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. regulators on Thursday voted to keep Prudential Financial on their list of systemically important firms subject to tougher oversight  the U.S. Treasury said.

column4: Rite Aid same-store sales miss estimates hurt by new generic drugs
column5: Rite Aid Corp  which has agreed to be bought by larger rival Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  reported same-store sales below analysts estimates hurt by the introduction of more low-margin generic drugs.

column4: UPDATE 1-Rite Aid same-store sales miss estimates hurt by new generic drugs
column5: Dec 17 Rite Aid Corp  which has agreed to be bought by larger rival Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc   reported same-store sales below analysts estimates hurt by the introduction of more low-margin generic drugs.

column4: Rite Aid profit drops 43 pct  hurt by EnvisionRx expenses
column5: Dec 17 Drugstore operator Rite Aid Corp  which has agreed to be bought by larger rival Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  reported a 43 percent drop in quarterly profit  hurt by expenses related to its acquisition of pharmacy benefit manager EnvisionRx.

column4: Telus shares sunk by rival Shaw's move on Wind
column5: TORONTO Cable company Shaw Communications Inc  gutpunched its main telecom rival with a surprise offer to buy wireless operator Wind Mobile  sinking shares in Telus Corp  on Thursday amid competition fears.

column4: Telus shares sunk by rival Shaw's move on Wind
column5: TORONTO  Dec 17 Cable company Shaw Communications Inc gutpunched its main telecom rival with a surprise offer to buy wireless operator Wind Mobile  sinking shares in Telus Corp on Thursday amid competition fears.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX falls as telecoms drag after Shaw's Wind Mobile bid
column5: TORONTO  Dec 17 Canada's main stock index slipped on Thursday as telecom stocks weighed after Shaw Communications Inc said it planned to jump into wireless with a C$1.6 billion bid for recent entrant Wind Mobile.

column4: Shaw Communications eyes wireless in C$1.6 billion Wind Mobile bid
column5: VANCOUVER/TORONTO Canada's Shaw Communications Inc   said on Wednesday it has agreed to buy Wind Mobile  the country's fourth-largest wireless provider  in a deal that gives it a much-needed presence in the cellular market.

column5: OSLO  Dec 17 Norwegian oil firm Statoil  said on Thursday it would present its development plan for its Oseberg Vestflanken 2 project offshore Norway on Friday.

column4: State lender says doesn't rule out investing in Telecom Italia
column5: ROME Italian state lender Cassa Depositi e Prestiti does not rule out investing in Telecom Italia  if talks between the latter and CDP-controlled firm Metroweb over joining forces to build an ultrafast nationwide fiber optic network succeeds  its chairman said.

column4: Govt does not make choices for Telecom Italia - Italy econ min
column5: ROME  Dec 17 Italy's government does not make choices on behalf of Telecom Italia  Economy Minister Pier Carlo Padoan said on Thursday  amid concerns about recent changes to the shareholder structure of the former monopoly network operator.

column4: TransCanada ups Energy East pipeline cost estimate by 30 percent
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Dec 17 TransCanada Corp  increased the estimated cost of its Energy East crude oil pipeline by 30 percent to C$15.7 billion on Thursday as it filed an amendment to its application with Canadian regulators.

column4: African Development Bank approves loan for Vale Nacala rail plan
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Dec 17 The African Development Bank approved a plan to provide as much as $300 million to help Brazilian mining company Vale SA finance the expansion of the Nacala logistics corridor in East Africa  Vale said in a statement on Thursday.

column4: Disney's 'Star Wars' rakes in $14.1 million in opening day sales
column5: Walt Disney Co's "Star Wars: The Force Awakens " billed as the biggest movie release of the year  raked in $14.1 million in ticket sales on its opening day in some international markets.

column4: Whirlpool seeks duties on Samsung  LG washers made in China
column5: WASHINGTON Whirlpool Corp asked the U.S. government on Wednesday to impose duties on washers made by Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics in China  alleging that they are being sold in the United States at prices below production costs.
